\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 48288}

\subsection*{Food for Thought}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Anonymous}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 &   & oral & Ginkgo biloba & daily\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 70.00 kg\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
I started taking ginkgo because my bud smoking was doing mean things to my short term memory (actually I'm stoned now). 2 capsules  a day. a month later I'm able to recall childhood memories in way more detail(I'm 20), concentration has definitely improved and I feel I'm using a broader vocabulary in normal daily conversations (acid was the one who made me read the dictionary in the first place). Short term memory is still fucked, especially when I forget to take ginkgo for a day or maybe my keys just like playing hide and seek.
